channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In the U.K., Reddit is king
item.description: Reddit is now the fourth most visited social media platform in the U.K., overtaking TikTok . The online discussion platform has seen immense growth ov...

item.title: What Apple’s AI deal with Google means for the two tech giants, and for $500 billion ‘upstart’ OpenAI
item.description: The multi-year partnership validates Google's AI comeback, highlights Apple's AI struggles, and could spell trouble for OpenAI.

item.title: Want to Boost Your Intelligence? Science Says Start Taking a Multivitamin
item.description: Granted, the effect might take three years to accumulate… but the results are dramatic.

item.title: The Philippines, ASEAN’s new chair, starts 2026 on a ‘weaker footing’ after trade tensions and a $2 billion corruption scandal
item.description: Third-quarter GDP growth in the Philippines fell to a four-year low of 4%, prompting Manila to slash growth targets for 2026 through 2028.

item.title: AI Holograms Are Here. What Does This Mean for AI Companions?
item.description: It’s not a bad idea, in theory. Giving AI a face is not just a marketing ploy but a biological inevitability.

item.title: Why it feels so good when a meeting gets canceled, according to science
item.description: You know the feeling: You’re replying to emails, navigating open tabs, responding to direct messages, when suddenly, it happens—your standing weekly 2...

item.title: Ben Franklin Found the Secret to Happy Aging 275 Years Ago. Modern Psychology Agrees
item.description: Founding father Ben Franklin lived to 84, enjoying excellent mental and physical health. Ignore his approach to aging at your peril.

item.title: Fujifilm’s new camera has a ‘Gen Dial’ so Gen Z can get the perfect retro shot
item.description: Fujifilm’s newest camera model, the Instax Mini Evo Cinema , is a gadget that’s designed for the retro camera craze . The device is a vertically orien...

item.title: AI hyperscalers need to restore trust—here’s how
item.description: It’s hard to avoid the conclusion that the market for artificial intelligence and its associated industries are over inflated. In 2025, just five hype...

item.title: Why Levi’s is teaching high schoolers how to mend their clothes
item.description: Amanda Lee McCarty, sustainability consultant and host of the Clotheshorse podcast, remembers fixing a tear on her Forever 21 shirt with a stapler—jus...

item.title: Carhartt CEO says they always focused on blue-collar workers—but hipsters came anyway: ‘We welcome anyone … that wants to celebrate hard work’
item.description: "We don't try to be everything to everybody," Carhartt CEO Linda Hubbard told Fortune, as she announced a blue-collar partnership with Ford Philanthro...

item.title: With Its Google Gemini Deal, Apple Just Made Its Most Intelligent Move Yet
item.description: The deal to power Siri makes sense for everyone involved, even if it goes against Apple’s usual playbook.

item.title: Investors Make a Bold Move to Rescue Troubled Whiskey Brand Uncle Nearest as Owners Fight for Control
item.description: The owners don’t want to sell, but a $108 million loan is looming.

item.title: Elon Musk says humans are ‘pre-programmed to die’ and longevity is ‘solvable’, raising huge questions about the future of health
item.description: Musk once said he’d “prefer to be dead” than live to 100 with dementia or as a burden to society.

item.title: U.S workers just took home their smallest share of capital since 1947, at least
item.description: American workers aren’t just getting the smallest share of GDP since records began. Their share of employment is shrinking and shrinking
